name: waywardly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you behave waywardly, you do only what you want, and often change your behaviour in a way that is difficult to control: His brother might waywardly show up out of the blue and visit for a couple of weeks, then we won't hear from him again for another year. She was a waywardly eccentric genius on the tennis court.
More examplesFewer examplesEarly in her career she had a waywardly brief stint working at a national culture magazine. The actor would often stray waywardly from the script, which made it difficult for his fellow cast members. As a jazz musician, he was a waywardly inspirational genius.
